Description: Sandal for the right foot, one of a pair made from woven cord. The simple but functional design features a sole of woven fibre, with a thong designed to fit between the first and second toe. This thong was joined to the strap that ran around the ankle .
Curator's comments: Though made of palm, the form of sandal Louvre N1305 replicates that of EA 4419. See V. Montembault. Catalogue des Chaussures de l'Antiquité Égyptienne (Louvre Catalogue, Paris, 2000: 39). Sandals were a common part of the elite New Kingdom burial assemblage (Smith, MDAIK 48 [1992]: 209-10). Dating sandals without archaeological context is difficult, as shown by the variety of types found in the East Cemetery at Deir el-Medina - Les artistes de pharaon (exhibition catalogue, Paris, 2000), 46 fig.24.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr Gideon Algernon Mantell
